channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2023100894
item.description:
Report E-2023100894

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 25 gallons of Xylenes (UN1263) released from a drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the trailer & concrete. It was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Terminal personnel overpacked the impacted drum into 1-85 gal dm and contaienrized spent absorbents into 1-20 gal dm. The waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023100018
item.description:
Report X-2023100018

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023100018-LOADER DISCOVERED LEAKING PACKAGE AND REPORTED IT TO THEIR SUPERVISOR AND THEN THE SUPERVISOR REPORTED THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE RESPONDERS, THE RESPONDERS CLEANED UP THE AREA OF THE SPILLAND THEN TOOK THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE CAGE FOR FUTHER PROCESSING X-2023100019- PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED LEAKING PACKAGE, NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR WHO ALERTED RESPONDERS THAT CLEANED UP SPILL AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023100007
item.description:
Report X-2023100007

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/09/2023 at approximatley 1040, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 291445 at the hub facility in Indianapolis , reporting a flammable liqud spill, The shipment consisted of 4 plastic drums packaged in one fiberboard box. One of the plastic bottles leaked due to a loose closure, resulting in spillage. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and the shipment awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023091116
item.description:
Report X-2023091116

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED SIXTEEN TUBES OF FLAMMABLE ALPHA 1021 SELF LEVELING SEALANT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023090755
item.description:
Report X-2023090755

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release at the INDH facility during sort operations. The fiberboard box contained one glass bottle packaged with Styrofoam peanuts. The plastic cap on the bottle was sheered off causing a release. The package was placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The driver informed us that the HAZMAT package was leaking out of the box he gave the package to QA and we immediately put it in a HAZMAT drum. DescribePack: The package looks like it got bent in the inside by another package and it caused it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put it in a HAZMAT drum

item.title: Report X-2023090021
item.description:
Report X-2023090021

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08/23/2023 at approximately 1200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 868809 at the hub facility in Indianapolis, reporting a spill from a machanical part. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing a machine part. The part leaked from one of the ends of the piping, resulting in spillage. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and it awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023090014
item.description:
Report X-2023090014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023090024-On Aug 24th while moving the pallet, one of the jerrycans was punctured by the forklift. The jerrycan contained UN1210, Printing Ink, 3, II. The damaged jerrican was placed into a steel salvage drum, the spill was cleaned up and an amended shipper's declaration was received by the shipper. The shipment was continued onto destination. X-2023090015-On Aug 24th while moving the pallet, one of the jerrycans was punctured by the forklift. The jerrycan contained UN1210, Printing Ink, 3, II. The damaged jerrican was placed into a steel salvage drum, the spill was cleaned up and an amended shipper's declaration was received by the shipper. The shipment was continued onto destination.

item.title: Report X-2023082009
item.description:
Report X-2023082009

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Spill agent at the Indianapolis hub was contacted about a leaking package found in a drive lane. The fiberboard box had been crushed and the three plastic bottles inside were all damaged. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous materials.
